src:
Kembangkan Sektor Maritim Dan Pendidikan Vokasi, Jatim Kerjasama dengan Australia Barat
07 Nov 2019, 19:35 by Anik Hasanah


Kembangkan Sektor Maritim Dan Pendidikan Vokasi, Jatim Kerjasama dengan Australia Barat

KBRN, Surabaya : Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Timur terus mengembangkan  pendidikan vokasi diberbagai lembaga pendidikan di Jawa Timur. Sebagai upaya pengembangan tersebut, Gubernur Jawa Timur Khofifah Indar Parawansa menawarkan kerjasama pendidikan vokasi kepada Pemerintah Australia Barat."Pendidikan vokasi kebutuhannya sangat besar di Jatim. Tahun depan kerjasama provinsi Jawa Timur dengan Australia Barat telah berusia 30 tahun. Apa yang bisa kita  perbarui kerjasama akan kita lakukan, khususnya pendidikan, pariwisata dan perdagangan," ujar Khofifah saat menerima Menteri Australia Barat, Peter Tinley di Gedung Negara Grahadi Surabaya, Kamis (7/11/2019).Saat ini, jelas Gubernur Khofifah, Jatim sedang fokus terhadap pendidikan vokasi, utamanya SMK. Melalui pendidikan vokasi tersebut, diharapkan dapat membentuk keterampilan sesuai dengan kebutuhan pasar kerja."Sekarang sudah keluar Keputusan Presiden tentang Kawasan Ekonomi Khusus (KEK) Singhasari - Malang. KEK ini khususnya di bidang digital IT dan pariwisata. Kita berharap akan ada kemungkinan kerjasama tidak sekedar SMK, tetapi juga setelah mereka lulus SMK bisa mendapatkan penguatan skill khususnya melalui skema working holiday visa yang bisa kerja magang sampai dua tahun di perusahaan di Australia sesuai bidang masing- masing terutama sektor maritim. Program kerjasama antara Jatim dengan Australia Barat terutama untuk pendidikan vokasi secara khusus digital IT juga akan kami jadikan prioritas," kata mantan Menteri Sosial RI di era Presiden Jokowi ini.Gubernur perempuan pertama di Jatim ini juga menyampaikan, bahwa saat ini sudah mulai tumbuh sekitar 300- an start up di Jatim serta  perkembangan perusahaan  e-commerce yang membutuhkan skill khusus. Karena, persoalan tersebut menjadi kebutuhan di era industri 4.0. Misalnya saat ini kita sangat  kekurangan sumber daya manusia (SDM) khususnya di bidang coding.Terkait hal tersebut, Khofifah pun mengusulkan adanya kerjasama pelatihan teknis secara spesifik untuk mendapatkan ahli coding. Harapannya, ahli coding bisa mensupport perkembangan start up yang sedang  tumbuh subur di Jatim."Kita berharap bisa mendapatkan secara spesifik technical training untuk mendapatkan ahli coding untuk mensupport start up yang tumbuh cukup pesat di Jatim," ajaknya.Selain itu, orang nomor satu di Jatim ini juga menyambut baik peluang potensi kerjasama bidang maritim yang ditawarkan Menteri Australia Barat. Kerjasama tersebut bisa dilakukan dengan melihat potensi Indonesia dan Australia. Untuk Jatim sendiri, potensi yang sangat besar adalah Ikan Tuna. Karena itu, Australia Barat diharapkan bisa melakukan investasi pengolahan Ikan Tuna di Jatim, serta dapat mencarikan akses pasarnya. Gubernur Khofifah juga menginginkan ada pengolahan Ikan Tuna dalam bentuk fillet, sarden serta pritein ikan yang sangat terkenal di Australia. Sehingga ada nilai tambah bagi masyarakat penghasil Ikan Tuna di beberapa area di Jatim. "Kita punya potensi untuk Ikan Tuna. Ikan Tuna di Jatim besar sekali produksinya. Kita berharap Australia Barat akan invest untuk industri  pengolahan Ikan khususnya ikan  Tuna di sini. Kemudian pasarnya nanti dari Australia Barat mencarikan akses," tuturnya sambil menjelaskan saat ini Ikan Tuna besarnya bisa sampai 2 meter. Yang terbesar ini ada di Sendang Biru Malang dan saat ini sebagian besar langsung diekspor dalam bentuk ikan.Lebih lanjut disampaikannya, dalam memproduksi ikan diharapkan ada proses pengolahan, pengemasan kemudian baru dijual. Atau yang biasa disebutnya dengan istilah "petik, olah,  kemas, jual". "Makanya seperti Ikan Tuna di Sendang Biru Malang, kita berharap ada pengolahan di dekat penghasil Ikan Tuna, di Malang bagian selatan itu. Tidak dijual mentahan," tegasnya.Sementara itu, Menteri Australia Barat Peter Tinley mengatakan, kerjasama Australia Barat dengan Jatim akan memasuki usia ke-30 tahun pada tahun 2020. Karena itu, pihaknya ingin kolaborasi yang lebih erat lagi dengan Jatim. Ada pembahasan beberapa kerjasama yang akan ditingkatkan antara Australia Barat dengan Jatim. Antara lain pendidikan dan vokasi yang merupakan kekuatan Australia Barat, juga termasuk pariwisata.Selain itu juga kerjasama di bidang maritim akan dikembangkan terutama untuk mendukung perkapalan Jatim, memberdayakan anak-anak muda Jatim sehingga mempunyai kapasitas seperti standar Australia."Salah satunya melalui penggunaan fasilitas yang ada yaitu working holiday visa. Yang mana saat ini diberikan kepada 1.000 anak muda Indonesia agar bisa bekerja di Australia Barat. Nanti coba kita bersama Ibu Gubernur akan dikelola beberapa kuota yang bisa diberikan untuk Jatim. Sehingga akan dapat mendukung industri yang ada di sini," imbuhnya.
text:
Develop Maritime Sector and Vocational Education, East Java in Collaboration with Western Australia
Nov 7 2019, 19:35 by Anik Hasanah


Develop Maritime Sector and Vocational Education, East Java in Collaboration with Western Australia

KBRN, Surabaya: The Government of East Java Province continues to develop vocational education in various educational institutions in East Java. As part of this development effort, East Java Governor Khofifah Indar Parawansa offers cooperation in vocational education to the Government of Western Australia. "Vocational education needs are very large in East Java. Next year the cooperation between the provinces of East Java and Western Australia is 30 years old. What can we renew the collaboration will we do, especially education, tourism and trade, "said Khofifah when receiving the Minister of Western Australia, Peter Tinley at the Grahadi State Building in Surabaya, Thursday (11/07/2019). At present, clearly Governor Khofifah, East Java is focused on vocational education, mainly SMK. Through vocational education, it is expected to be able to shape skills in accordance with the needs of the job market. "Now the Presidential Decree on the Special Economic Zone (KEK) of Singhasari - Malang has been issued. The SEZ is specifically in the field of digital IT and tourism. We hope there will be a possibility of cooperation not just SMKs, but also after they graduate SMKs can get skills strengthening especially through a working holiday visa scheme that can work internships for up to two years in companies in Australia according to their respective fields, especially in the maritime sector. Cooperation programs between East Java and Western Australia especially for vocational education in general specifically digital IT will also be our priority, "said the former Indonesian Minister of Social Affairs in the era of President Jokowi. The first female governor in East Java also said that currently there are around 300 start-ups in East Java and the development of e-commerce companies who need special skills. Because, these problems become a necessity in the industrial era 4.0. For example, currently we are very short of human resources (HR), especially in the field of coding. Related to this, Khofifah also proposes a specific technical cooperation collaboration to get coding experts. The hope, coding experts can support the development of start-ups that are flourishing in East Java. "We hope to get specific technical training to get coding experts to support start-ups that grow quite rapidly in East Java," he said. In addition, the number one person in East Java also welcomed the potential opportunities for maritime cooperation offered by the Minister of Western Australia. This collaboration can be done by looking at the potential of Indonesia and Australia. For East Java itself, a huge potential is Tuna. Therefore, Western Australia is expected to invest in processing tuna fish in East Java, and can find market access. Governor Khofifah also wants Tuna fish processing in the form of fillets, sardines and fish pritein which is very well known in Australia. So there is added value for the Tuna Fish producing community in several areas in East Java. "We have the potential for Tuna. Tuna in East Java has a huge production. We hope that Western Australia will invest in the fish processing industry, especially Tuna fish here. Then later the market from Western Australia will find access," he said while explaining the current large tuna fish. can be up to 2 meters. The biggest one is in Sendang Biru Malang and currently most of it is directly exported in the form of fish. He further said that in producing fish it is expected that there will be processing, packaging and then selling it. Or commonly referred to as "picking, processing, selling, selling". "So, like Tuna in Sendang Biru Malang, we hope that there is processing near Tuna fish producers, in southern Malang. It is not sold raw," he said. Meanwhile, Western Australian Minister Peter Tinley said, Western Australia's cooperation with East Java would enter age of 30 years in 2020. Therefore, it wants even closer collaboration with East Java. There are discussions of several collaborations that will be improved between Western Australia and East Java. Among other things, education and vocational, which is the strength of Western Australia, also includes tourism. In addition, cooperation in the maritime field will be developed primarily to support the shipping of East Java, empowering young people of East Java so that they have the capacity as Australian standards. "One of them is through the use of facilities that are there is a working holiday visa. Which is currently given to 1,000 Indonesian young people to be able to work in Western Australia. Later we try with the Governor will be managed by several quotas that can be given to East Java. So that will be able to support the industry here, " he added.
